title: Hot property: five homes for sale in Stockholm and its suburbs
text:
House, Tyresö Strand, SKr39.5mn ($3.65mn)

Where On the coastline of Erstaviken bay, just over 20km south-east of central Stockholm. It is roughly one hour's drive away from Stockholm Arlanda international airport.

What A five-bedroom, 430 sq m house with an outdoor pool, cinema room, 1,300-bottle wine cellar, gym, sauna and hot tub. Its large, raised garden includes a greenhouse.

Why The waterfront property has its own jetty and boathouse, and has views across the bay.

Who Christie's International Real Estate

Apartment, Östermalm, SKr25mn

Where In Östermalm, a smart neighbourhood in the city centre, near the historic Royal Stables and less than 20 minutes' walk from Stockholm's Central Station.

What A three-bedroom penthouse apartment of 125 sq m, which was built in 1903 and renovated in 2018. Its south-facing terrace looks out across the city's rooftops.

Why The apartment has an artistic history — the 19th-century painter Carl Larsson once used this space as his studio. The main open-plan living and kitchen space is framed by large slanted roof windows.

Who Wrede

House, Djursholm, SKr125mn

Where In a northern suburb about 12km from the city centre, within a short walk of local restaurants and shops, and 10 minutes' walk from the coast. The airport is less than 45 minutes' drive.

What A Palladian-style villa built in 1896 and renovated over six years up to 2002. The 691 sq m house has five bedrooms, as well as a library, gym, spa and wine cellar.

Why The villa's period interior takes inspiration from a mixture of styles and places, including Château de Malmaison, Napoleon's residence near Paris. Outside, the landscaped garden also includes an orangery.

Who Christie's International Real Estate

House, Stocksund, SKr29mn

Where In Stocksund, a suburb 15-20 minutes' drive north of central Stockholm. Edsviken, a popular waterway for leisure use, is nearby.

What A three-storey house with 493 sq m of living space, including eight bedrooms. A terrace and balcony overlook the sloped garden, which is surrounded by mature trees.

Why The property was built in 1910 and the interior details have been retained, such as elegant plasterwork, parquet flooring, window seats and fireplaces.

Who Sotheby's International Realty

House, Färingsö, SKr22mn

Where On the island of Färingsö in Stockholm County, about 45 minutes' drive from the city centre.

What A six-bedroom villa built in 1905. The house has 395 sq m of renovated living space plus a large attic, which has potential for restoration. At the bottom of the mature garden, which includes apple trees, the property has its own mooring on Lake Mälaren.

Why The house has undergone an extensive restoration, including the repair and rebuilding of its distinctive spires and balcony.

Who Wrede
